items.title: Jibble Group: QA Automation Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
QA Automation Engineer

 
We’re looking for an experienced QA Engineer to work on the Jibble cloud product. It’s an exciting opportunity for someone who is looking for a new challenge with a fast-growing startup targeting the fastest-growing region in the world - South-East Asia. The position offers a highly competitive salary and equity in the company. We also have an annual product team meetup for our remote workers.

Our current Jibble and PayrollPanda products have been built using the Backbone.JS front-end framework but for Jibble 2.0 we’ll be using Vue. For test automation we use Xray and Cypress.


Your responsibilities will include:

  • Review and analyze system specifications
  • Write new test cases
  • Conduct manual tests following tests cases
  • Report bugs and errors to development teams
  • Help troubleshoot issues
  • Create logs to document testing phases and defects
  • Conduct post-release/ post-implementation testing
  • Test Automation for all the supported platforms.

Job requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience.
  • Able to spot problems from the product, development, and user’ perspectives.
  • Great hard and soft skills
  • Competent in contemporary JS based QA technologies and toolsets (Cypress).
  • Experience in API testing.
  • Know when to manually test and when to automate.
  • Able to identify priorities and application hotspots for Automated testing.
  • Ability to document and troubleshoot errors
  • Analytical and structured with high attention to detail
  • Experience working in remote teams is an advantage
  • Located within UTC - UTC+8 time zones
  • Fluent in English

items.title: Tester - Expansion
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=4, java=2, gamedev=0, php=8, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
We're looking for a tester to join our new Expansion squad, with a mission to accelerate growth outside our UK core business. You can apply your initiative, expertise and experience to help improve testing and quality across our teams and help us build a work-class shopping platform that our customers love using.

We’re Bloom & Wild, the UK’s most loved online florist. We’re using technology to reimagine the experience of buying and receiving flowers, connecting people more thoughtfully to make sending flowers a joy to send and a delight to receive. In doing so we're aiming to become Europe’s most loved flower brand. We’ve raised over £20million in venture capital funding and were recently named as the second-fastest growing tech company in the UK by Deloitte. One of the Tech Nation “Future Fifty” alumni and one of the Sunday Times Top 100 Small Companies to Work For 2020, we’re now the fastest growing online flower company in Europe.

Our business has, so far, been in the fortunate position to be able to continue trading and growing during this time of economic uncertainty, with the Government actively encouraging online retail, and customer demand for flowers for their loved ones is strong due to social distancing measures in place.

This a new role and you’ll be working closely with our Business Development team. You'll focus on solutions that build our international markets, develop new distribution channels and support the development of new products and services. Expansion is one of four squads in the technology team. Each squad is a small, close-knit team of developers, a product manager, tester and engineering manager/scrum master.

You'll get to work on our industry leading website and iOS / Android apps, powered by a technology stack which includes Angular and Ruby on Rails. Together these provide a best-in-class shopping experience for our customers.

You can read more about our technology over on our tech blog - Code & Wild.

You

You'll be testing our website, backend systems, iOS and Android applications. With a focus on exploratory testing you'll take a risk-based approach and deliver high-quality solutions. You enjoy working with developers to help them become better testers and you're eager to learn, favouring collaborative approaches (such as a face -to-face conversations over detailed bug reports) and helping make testing a team activity.

You're creative and enjoy coming up with new ideas to improve processes and overcome challenges. You’ll champion quality and understand how it can be improved at every stage of software development. You value learning as well as sharing your knowledge and helping the whole company understand what good quality is.

You enjoy leading the testing effort within your squad, including test management, execution and reporting, across multiple concurrent projects.

You ideally have an interest or experience in automation, have worked on eCommerce sites before and have some app testing experience.

Working Environment

Currently our full team is working from home and we’ve adapted to being fully remote. In addition to our normal perks and benefits we’re supporting each other and maintaining our culture remotely through:

  • Regular virtual yoga classes with more virtual exercise variety to come!
  • Celebrating birthdays with letterbox cake
  • Weekly ‘team drinks trolleys’ and updates from our senior team
  • Remote lunch and learns
  • Supporting our wellbeing through online support sessions and employee assistance program
  • New slack channels and ways of communicating including wellbeing channels
  • Specialist online support to talk about the challenges we are facing in the current environment

We have a lovely, light and spacious office conveniently located close to Vauxhall and Oval stations in London. Our Expansion squad is remote first and so we’re flexible on location for the role. When we’re back in the office then you can choose to split your time between there and your home if you wish.

We have an informal, startup culture, with employee-friendly policies such as:

  • 25 days holiday, with an additional day off for your birthday, plus bank holidays, totalling 34 days, per annum
  • Free breakfast, snacks and team lunches
  • Season ticket loan
  • Childcare Vouchers
  • Health cash plan through Simplyhealth
  • Personal Development Budget
  • Family Friendly Policy - including enhanced family friendly packages and a salary sacrifice childcare scheme
  • Pension Contribution
  • Cycle to Work Scheme
  • Lunch & Learns
  • Discounted blooms
  • Bloom & Go Wild trips - most recently we went to Paris!

But why take our word for it? This video gives you a real insight into what it’s like to work at Bloom & Wild https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AhLIQv_sdHw

Recruitment Process

The interview process consists of a 30 minute phone call with either Deborah our Senior Tester, or one of our Engineering Managers. Since we’re all working remotely at present then we’ll follow this up with two video calls, during which you’ll get the chance to meet more of the team including our testers, VP Engineering and a member of our Product team.

items.content:
Job Description



We’re not going to be the next Uber, and we don’t want to be. We have a small, passionate team that cares deeply about our customer’s success. We believe in steady growth, quality service and producing an excellent product.


We produce proofreading software that finds mistakes that spelling and grammar checkers can’t spot, such as consistency errors and style issues. Search for our software (PerfectIt) and you’ll see from the reviews that it makes a tangible difference to the working lives of our customers.


We’ve been a fully remote employer since 2015 (before it was cool).


The Role


You’ll be our Employee Number 9! As our QA tester, you will work 10 hours per week to improve the quality of our website and product by:



  • Testing new features and functionality though both manual and automation techniques.

  • Creation and modification of test plans to accurately match the released applications.

  • Communicating issues found and the best path to replications.


Benefits



  • Flexible working hours (10 hours per week).

  • 100% remote (work from anywhere in the UK).

  • Regular virtual social events and yearly get togethers.

  • Salary of £25-28k (pro-rata)


A Typical Week


You will:



  • Create and maintain test plans.

  • Help define and maintain smoke tests.

  • Manually test new and existing features.

  • Help maintain and grow UI and end-to-end automated tests.

  • Join in elsewhere (it’s a small team and there’s always work to jump into).


About You


You care about quality and excellence (in language and in software). You’re a clear communicator, dependable, and highly collaborative. You have:



  • Prior experience within software development, with a good understanding of software development cycles.

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills, and a deep understanding of the English language.

  • A degree in a relevant subject (e.g. Computing or English), or equivalent experience with QA and software development.

  • An ability to work from home (Intelligent Editing has no offices).

items.title: Knack: QA Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=20}
items.content:
QA Engineer

We're Knack, a no-code productivity platform that’s redefining how work gets done. Knack is used by thousands of customers — from non-profits to the world’s biggest organizations — to run processes, departments, and even entire companies


We need an amazing QA engineer to help us deliver an outstanding and reliable product. We’re looking for someone who’s not just an expert at reading and executing test cases, but someone who can assess and improve our overall test coverage.

And did I mention self-motivated and independent? This is a 100% remote role, with a flat culture that gives you the autonomy to define how you can do the best work of your career.

In this role, you will:
  • Manually test features and bug fixes, ensuring developed code is thoroughly and accurately tested before release to production.
  • Assess test coverage and build integration and end-to-end tests using Cypress and Ghost Inspector that will minimize regression and improve confidence in the code base.
  • Maintain internal documentation on QA best practices, notes, and SOPs, so others can assist with QA with minimal friction.
  • Identify and read functional and unit tests written in Mocha.
  • Manage a prioritized QA backlog.
  • Build and implement tools and processes that will improve our development operations.
  • Work closely with product and engineering to design and execute testing plans for new features.
We’re looking for someone who is:
  • A logical and critical thinker. You can quickly get up to speed and understand complex domain knowledge.
  • Experienced communicator who can work with cross-functional teams to create and execute plans.
  • Passionate about process and structure. You can prioritize what is most important and create repeatable processes to improve common workflows.
  • Focused on the problem. You can go heads down to understand the root cause of a bug.
  • You embrace a dynamic and fast paced environment. You have experience balancing multiple projects and priorities.
  • Humble but opinionated. You have lots of ideas, yet you are happy to shift directions when a better path emerges. You take your work much more seriously than you take yourself.
  • Engaging beyond tests. You understand that empathizing with our customers, building relationships with your co-workers, and going deep on the product makes you a better teammate and a better engineer.
Our Stack
  • Backend - JavaScript, Node, ES6
  • Data - Both SQL and NoSQL, Postgres, Mongo, Redis, Solr, ElasticSearch
  • DevOps & Deployment - All things AWS, Jenkins, Github
  • Testing - Cypress, Ghost Inspector, Mocha
  • Frontend - Vue.js, Webpack, SCSS

More about Knack:
https://knack.com/about-us
https://knack.com/careers

Post and apply:
https://knack.com/careers/qa-engineer

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Remote | Entry-level | International

Job description

  • MailerLite is one of the fastest-growing email marketing services. We help 865,611 businesses around the world to keep in touch with their customers.
  • In order to do even bigger things, we need people in our team that are passionate and great at what they’re doing.
  • We’re looking for a QA Tester who would ensure that our features work as expected and there are no bugs.

Why MailerLite?

Wondering why we think you’ll love working for MailerLite? Here are 6 reasons!

  • You won’t be bored
  • Our customers are sending more than 30 million emails per day.
  • Scaling our platform while building new amazing features will keep you engaged.
  • You will be working closely with development and product teams to ensure project success.
  • You will be challenged with interesting tasks
  • Our application is growing fast with new feature releases every day.
  • We need you to make sure our speed matches our quality.
  • Your responsibilities will involve troubleshooting and triaging issues with multiple teams to drive towards root cause identification and resolution.
  • Take ownership
  • We don’t micromanage and try not to interrupt your work with random tasks. We do expect you to take full responsibility and ownership for the stuff you build.
  • You’ll have experts at hand
  • Whenever you’re stuck, your teammates are eager to help you grow. And they’d love for you to share your knowledge too!
  • You can pick where you want to work, every day
  • At MailerLite, we embrace the remote culture. Half of the team works from the office in Vilnius, the others are spread around the world. Every day you get to choose what environment makes you most productive.
  • You can count on stability
  • We’re not a startup that’s burning investor money. MailerLite has been around for more than 10 years and is a profitable company that continues to grow. You can count on us to offer you a stable workplace!

Requirements

  • Work experience of at least a year in a QA role in SaaS (Software as a Service)
  • Knowledge of HTML and API
  • Experience with web UX/UI testing
  • Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Ability to quickly acquire technical and professional knowledge
  • Some experience in writing test plan and test cases (preferably)
  • Knowledge of how to troubleshoot and diagnose issues
  • Self-motivated attitude
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks
  • Outstanding attention to detail (if you apply, include the word lite somewhere in your newsletter)
  • Ability to work with teams across multiple time zones and countries

What we offer

  • Competitive salary: $25,000-$30,000 (gross)
  • Remote-first culture with half of the team in Vilnius, Lithuania and the other half working remotely from all over the world
  • Office or remote? You get to choose every day
  • Free healthy lunches, snacks and coffee in the Vilnius office
  • Company-paid retreats that we call workations. We gather twice a year for a week in an exotic location to work, learn and have fun together
  • Generous vacation policy. Take time off when you need it. We trust you
  • Company-paid creative days. Go out explore and share your discoveries with the team afterward
  • MacBook Pro and other tools that’ll help you to do your job efficiently
Apply for job

items.content:
QA Tester

Job description

MailerLite is one of the fastest-growing email marketing services. We help 865,513 businesses around the world to keep in touch with their customers.

In order to do even bigger things, we need people in our team that are passionate and great at what they’re doing. We’re looking for a QA Tester who would ensure that our features work as expected and there are no bugs.


Why MailerLite?

Wondering why we think you’ll love working for MailerLite? Here are 6 reasons!

You won’t be bored
Our customers are sending more than 30 million emails per day. Scaling our platform while building new amazing features will keep you engaged. You will be working closely with development and product teams to ensure project success.

You will be challenged with interesting tasks
Our application is growing fast with new feature releases every day. We need you to make sure our speed matches our quality. Your responsibilities will involve troubleshooting and triaging issues with multiple teams to drive towards root cause identification and resolution.

Take ownership
We don’t micromanage and try not to interrupt your work with random tasks. We do expect you to take full responsibility and ownership for the stuff you build.

You’ll have experts at hand
Whenever you’re stuck, your teammates are eager to help you grow. And they’d love for you to share your knowledge too!

You can pick where you want to work, every day
At MailerLite, we embrace the remote culture. Half of the team works from the office in Vilnius, the others are spread around the world. Every day you get to choose what environment makes you most productive.

You can count on stability
We're not a startup that's burning investor money. MailerLite has been around for more than 10 years and is a profitable company that continues to grow. You can count on us to offer you a stable workplace!


Requirements
  • Work experience of at least a year in a QA role in SaaS (Software as a Service)
  • Knowledge of HTML and API
  • Experience with web UX/UI testing
  • Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Ability to quickly acquire technical and professional knowledge
  • Some experience in writing test plan and test cases (preferably)
  • Knowledge of how to troubleshoot and diagnose issues
  • Self-motivated attitude
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks
  • Outstanding attention to detail (if you apply, include the word lite somewhere in your newsletter)
  • Ability to work with teams across multiple time zones and countries

What we offer
  • Competitive salary: $25,000-$30,000 (gross)
  • Remote-first culture with half of the team in Vilnius, Lithuania and the other half working remotely from all over the world
  • Office or remote? You get to choose every day
  • Free healthy lunches, snacks and coffee in the Vilnius office
  • Company-paid retreats that we call workations. We gather twice a year for a week in an exotic location to work, learn and have fun together
  • Generous vacation policy. Take time off when you need it. We trust you
  • Company-paid creative days. Go out explore and share your discoveries with the team afterward
  • MacBook and other tools that'll help you to do your job efficiently

Interested?

Don't send us a CV. We like to do things differently.

Instead, here is how we would like you to apply:
  1. Sign up for a free MailerLite account.
  2. Go to "Campaigns", create a newsletter and send the preview URL to jobs@mailerlite.com. You'll find this URL in the editor under "Preview and test" and then "Preview mode."
Before you create the email, you will need your new account to be approved. In the approval form, you will be asked how you collect subscribers and what type of content you plan to send. Just write "Job application."


Things we want to see in your newsletter:
  • The title of this role in your email subject line
  • How you heard about this job
  • Links to your LinkedIn and/or personal homepage
  • Previous companies you worked for, your role, projects you worked on
  • Why you want to join MailerLite
  • Your remote work experience
  • Your description of a project or product that you loved working on and why
  • Expected salary
We wish you all the best of luck!

items.title: Quality Analyst – Call Center
items.content:
Remote
  • Location: United States
  • Classifications: Remote

JOB DESCRIPTION

Our Internal Recruiter will use their expertise to source, identify, screen and present the highest caliber talent for all of our internal corporate departments hiring needs. They will partner with Hiring Managers to calibrate and collaborate on what the best fit is for a position, then proceed to present a short list of the top ranked candidates to the Hiring Manager for final selection, and hire. They act as the main point of contact for our internal candidates all the way through their screening process with Broadpath, providing them an engaged and enjoyable candidate experience.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Be an active and positive contributor to the team’s professionalism and BroadPath culture
  • Produce high-quality results, meeting and exceeding all goals
  • Serve as a subject matter expert in recruiting
  • Produce high-quality results, meeting and exceeding all project goals
  • Implement recruiting and sourcing strategies that ensure each line-of-business has a talent network made up of best-in-industry resources, including passive talent
  • Quickly execute recruiting strategies for delivering top-quality talent and meeting hiring plans in a very timely and consistently

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Minimum of 2 years recruiting experience in a corporate hiring environment
  • Exceptional recruiting/sourcing skills
  • Thrives in a fast-paced high-quality recruiting environment with ever-changing priorities
  • Ability to work occasional weekends to meet client deadlines

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Previous work at home experience
  • Previous experience with Salesforce

items.title: Backend Integration Test Engineer at ThreatConnect, Inc.
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Backend Integration Test Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer, QA/Test Developer
Industry: Cybersecurity, Enterprise Software, Security Software
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: ThreatConnect, Inc. – No office location

Technologies

python
automation
backend
sql
api

Job description

Company Description

Designed by analysts but built for the entire team (security operations, threat intelligence, incident response and security leadership), ThreatConnect’s intelligence-driven security operations platform is the only solution available today with intelligence, automation, analytics, and workflows in a single platform. With ThreatConnect, organizations can centralize their intelligence, establish process consistency, scale operations, and measure their effectiveness in one place. To learn more about our threat intelligence platform (TIP) or security orchestration, automation, and response (SOAR) solutions, visit ThreatConnect.com.

Job Description

We are in search of an Integration Test Engineer to become an integral part of our growing software engineering team. If you excel at working in tandem with developers to deliver quality software solutions, are proficient solving tough software and system integration challenges, and enjoy working with a QA team, we'd like to talk with you. We are looking for QA engineers who are comfortable in all phases of the SDLC, who can help start projects off right through test strategy and planning, and who are willing to get their hands dirty with black, gray and white box testing. Systems integration experience is a necessity, much of what we do involves testing a core piece of complex software and then proceed to system integration testing of the same.

Responsibilities:

  • Leverage your understanding of QA methodologies and best practices to design, build and execute unit, functional and integration test cases.
  • Guide, define, document, present and manage quality assurance and test plans.
  • Work closely with software developers and systems engineers to perform all levels of testing, as well as be an integral part of solving complex system level challenges.
  • Write, implement, analyze and report test status for projects.
  • Keep abreast of current and new technologies and tools related to your field.
  • In-depth understanding of industry-leading QA tools, techniques, and platforms.
  • Knowledge of unit testing, automation testing, regression testing, end-to-end testing, etc.
  • Hands on experience working in a CI/CD environment.
  • Working knowledge of building out Automation Frameworks, knowledge of automation best practices.
  • Working knowledge of performance testing and bench marking.
  • Working knowledge of Agile/Scrum.

Qualifications:

  • B.S. Computer Science or related degree
  • 2+ years' experience developing in Python
  • Proficient in core Python principles, concepts and methodologies
  • Experience working with Python 2.7 and 3.x
  • 5+ years' Quality Assurance/test experience required
  • Understanding of and experience with all aspects of the software development life cycle
  • Exposure to API automation tools
  • Comfortable with REST APIs and SQL databases
  • Previous experience installing and testing applications within a Linux environment
  • Knowledge and understanding of threat intelligence analysis is a plus
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Legally authorized to work in the United States

Work-Life Balance:

  • 10 Paid Federal Holidays
  • Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) for vacation/sick, time
  • Your birthday off
  • Employee recognition program with quarterly awards
  • Employee referral program
  • Military leave options available
  • Education reimbursement program for job-related college courses and professional training
  • Company-provided refreshments at our headquarters
  • Quarterly events with your geographic team
  • Annual company party

Medical:

  • MEDICAL PREMIUM FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES ARE 100% COVERED
  • Prescription drug coverage
  • Dental coverage
  • Vision coverage
  • Company-paid short term and long term disability
  • Company-paid insurance and AD&D coverage
  • Pet Insurance

Financial:

  • 401K retirement savings plan with company matching program up to 6%
  • Health Savings Account
  • Flexible Spending Accounts (medical, dependent care, transit and parking)
  • Cell phone stipend
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Paid Bereavement Leave
Apply

About ThreatConnect, Inc.

Does analyzing cyber threats excite you? Do you build your own software programs just because it’s fun? Are you searching for a challenging work environment and the excitement of a startup? Do you want to work alongside the best and brightest in the security industry? Look no further. We offer our employees the ability to go above and beyond the day-to-day drudgery and manage our flagship product, ThreatConnect®. We offer a comprehensive compensation package that includes a competitive salary, benefits, PTO and the potential for equity.

We are focused on keeping companies and people safe. Our company was founded on the belief that there was a better way to approach cybersecurity. Our ThreatConnect threat intelligence platform was built for anyone to use, and all of our users from our free accounts to paid versions benefit from our collaborative and powerful platform.

ARE YOU READY TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE?

We are always searching for highly skilled and dedicated engineering, sales, and marketing staff to join our growing team. We are hiring for our Cyber Squared consulting services, our ThreatConnect product development and engineering, our ThreatConnect Intelligence Research Team (TCIRT) and many other positions. The TCIRT is the research arm of ThreatConnect and is responsible for tracking existing and emerging threats on a daily basis, often sharing highly contextualized and dynamic threat intelligence to our global customers across public and private ThreatConnect communities.

We want motivated, passionate, and excited team members to join us and continue to develop, advance and discover a better way of doing things. If you are self-motivated, a problem-solver, and able to work efficiently from home and within a team environment, then we want you.

Benefits

  • 100% Medical/Dental/Vision Coverage
  • Paid Time Off
  • 401k Match (Up to 6%)
  • Work-Life Balance
  • Office Snacks & Drinks
  • Remote Friendly
  • Annual Company Parties and Quarterly Events with Team
  • Educational or Professional Development Reimbursement
  • Employee Recognition Programs
  • Military Leave Option

items.content:
Software QA Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Biotechnology, Collaboration Tools, Life Sciences
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Practichem – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time

Technologies

selenium
javascript
jenkins

Job description

What we do

Practichem, a Raleigh-based biotech firm focused on speeding antiviral cures to market, uses a patented protein chromatography instrumentation platform to deliver time and cost savings in the race to deliver critical viral health solutions worldwide. 

Chromatography instrument technology lags well behind consumer tech. Many current scientific instruments are controlled by 1993-era software. When compared to current technology, chromatography instruments do not store and share data well. Studies reveal scientists spending the majority of their applied time extracting, converting, and loading data as part of their workflow. This is not a research science problem, or a chromatographic problem. This requires a software technology solution.

Practichem believes scientific instrument software should be as intuitive to use as a smart phone app. We’re setting a new standard for the laboratory by creating browser based software that runs our scientific instruments. Help us drive innovation to the laboratory for greater discovery and collaboration.

Who we are

Practichem is a different kind of company and we like it that way. We have incredibly high standards and hire exceptional people who enjoy pushing themselves to perform at their highest levels every day. Join our team and enjoy an environment that appreciates hard work and achievements. 

What we expect

You appreciate a start-up environment free from bureaucracy. You thrive on open discussion. You have incredibly high standards for documentation and testing procedures. Organization and consistency are standard operating procedures for you.

This must excite you. You must be curious and practical. You will be expected to challenge and be challenged, to create and innovate. Practichem's work style is not for everyone. 

What you will do

  • Manage software testing and strategy.
  • Update tests to reflect the latest user stories.
  • Devise client and server system tests.
  • Write automated integration tests, maintain and update existing tests.
  • Participate in design discussions.
  • Test software and hardware on web applications and instrumentation.
  • Clearly and consistently document issues, bugs, and testing procedures.
  • Prepare and present technical information to departmental, cross-departmental, and executive groups.
  • Provide subject matter expertise and reach out for help when needed.
  • Juggle fast changing priorities, be process minded, and detail driven.

Preferred experience and skills

  • Bachelor's  degree plus at least 5 years relevant experience or demonstrated technical competencies plus at least 5 years relevant experience.
  • Javascript
  • Jenkins, Selenium, or Cucumber
  • JIRA or similar tracking system
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Understand and analyze complex issues.
  • Work with minimal supervision and document daily goals.
  • Have strong organizational skills.
  • Experience in scientific instrumentation.
  • Experience with databases.
  • Start-up environment experience.

What we offer

  • Competitive compensation and benefits. We work reasonable hours and rarely get called on nights, weekends, or holidays.
  • We support remote work.
  • You'll work alongside other accomplished engineers and scientists.
  • Choose a Mac or a PC. You can run Windows or a Linux distro.
  • Join Practichem and get $500 in cozy cash to set your workspace how you want. Buy a super mouse, a wrist thingy, a special chair, plant, mood ring, or maybe a Maneki-neko?

Fun

Make sure you’re having fun at work -- meet new friends, push yourself in new ways, try new things. If you aren’t having fun at some level, you’ll be unhappy. We don’t want that. We want you to work hard, love what you do, and have fun.

Apply

About Practichem

We do way more than the usual software full stack development. We are also mechanical, electronics hardware, and firmware engineers: Angular.js on JavaScript, less + coffeescript, some PostgreSQL and MongoDB database.

Backend: Database, CI/CD via Jenkins, maven, Selenium, Cucumber.

DevOps: VMWare-Ubuntu/CentOS, Docker with lots of other amazing goodies

Electronics: Altium, SolidWorks routing, lots of smaller simulation tools

Firmware: Atmel Studio, Python 3, C++

Mechanical: SolidWorks

Manufacturing: Odoo

Benefits

  • Dual 27" Monitors. See?
  • Competitive salaries. Ka-ching.
  • Chairs with lots of levers, knobs and buttons. Cool.
  • Deeply rewarding work. Cheer!
  • Health Insurance. Ahhh.
  • Cozy Cash. Mmm, comfy work environment.
  • Remote work. Hello PJs at noon!

Lead Automated Software Development Engineer in Test ~ SDET

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Database Administrator, QA/Test Developer
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Consulting, Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Railroad19 – No office location

Technologies

java
testng
oracle
cucumber

Job description

We are currently seeking a Lead Automated Software Development Engineer in Test ~ SDET with experience creating automated software tools to verify and quantify the quality of the produced software.   The right candidate is a self-driven individual with a passion for innovation, who will collaborate closely with developers, understand code, and write automated integration and regression tests in a clean and organized manner. We develop customized software solutions and provide software development services.  We’re a specialized team of developers and architects.  As such, we only bring an “A” team to the table, through hard work and a desire to lead the industry — this is our company culture — this is what sets Railroad19 apart.At Railroad19, you are part of a company that values your work and gives you the tools you need to succeed. We are headquartered in Saratoga Springs, New York, but we are a distributed team of remote developers across the US.   This is a full-time role with vacation, full benefits, and 401k.  Railroad19, Inc. provides competitive compensation with excellent benefits and a great corporate culture.Core responsibilities:
  • Understand our client's fast-moving business requirement
  • Develop and maintain test automation processes in alignment with the project and/or organization's standards and tools
  • Create automated software tools to verify and quantify the quality of the produced software
  • Mature and evolve test architecture through the evaluation and adoption of new automation tools, techniques, and practices
  • Participate in early story development and design sessions to suggest and assist in acceptance criteria, boundary tests, and automation plans
  • Once the story is ready to be tested, execute test cases and provide detailed and timely feedback
  • Uncover, document and track defects
  • Improve test case execution efficiency and test coverage
  • Write and/or perform Manual, Integrations, Acceptance Tests, Functional Tests (must be able to script automation tests)
  • Understand validation results of testing
  • Create training documentation & conduct knowledge transfer sessions
  • Work in an agile development environment, collaborating with the Engineering and Product teams to deliver quality software iteratively
  • Integrate QA processes into Software Development & Release Cycles Negotiate appropriate solutions with multiple stakeholders
  • Collaborate with other teams in order to deliver a high-performance application that contains little or no defects

Skills & Experience:

  • 5 or more years of professional experience testing Java, large data and demonstrated ability with developing and writing automation from scratch
  • 3 or more years of professional experience with: Java, JavaScript TestNG, Oracle database, Cucumber or like Cucumber libraries and other HTTP Request Client Libraries
  • Ability to Demonstrate understanding of authorization and authentication mechanisms
  • Experience with CI/CD tools, knowledge of how pipelines work and the ability to integrate automation into them.
  • Experience working with Jbehave/BDD style and Protractor Testing framework
  • Experience with build and configuration tools, such as Maven or Gradle
  • Experience with version control systems
  • Experience with JIRA and Confluence
  • Experience working in an Agile development and delivery environment
  • Experience with various Java IDE's: Eclipse, IntelliJ, NetBeans, etc.
We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
Apply

About Railroad19

At Railroad19, we develop customized software solutions and provide software development services.  At Railroad19, you are part of a company that values your work and gives you the tools you need to succeed. We are headquartered in Saratoga Springs, New York, but we are a distributed team of developers across the U.S. only.  Railroad19 provides competitive compensation, excellent benefits, 401k and a great culture.

Benefits

  • Employer 401K match plan
  • Brand new, modern and open office space
  • Located in downtown Saratoga and close to a variety of restaurants
  • Very Friendly and Upbeat work environment
  • Great location with free parking garages in close proximity
  • Competitive health, dental and vision insurance plans
  • Work Remotely
  • 24/7 Health Concierge Service for all employees
  • Competitive base salary
  • 3 weeks vacation to start

items.content:
QA Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps, QA/Test Developer
Industry: Cybersecurity
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Defiant Inc – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

php
nginx
amazon-s3
amazon-ec2
javascript

Job description

Defiant is a small, dynamic, fast-growing, and profitable company with loyal customers who love our products and services. We are the global leader in WordPress security, protecting over 3 million websites.

Are you excited about working for a technology company that is securing the web? Are you looking for full-time, flexible hours* working remotely from anywhere in the UK, Canada, United States, Australia, or New Zealand? If so, this may be your dream job!

*Required core hours of 10am - 2pm Pacific Time

This role is part of our QA team and will work closely with our Customer Support team to help resolve technical customer issues that require further investigation. In this role, you will:

  • Acquire and maintain an excellent technical understanding of Wordfence and other Defiant products.
  • Work directly with our development and customer service teams to design and execute test strategies and test cases. This is a hands-on role that requires both defining testing needs and performing testing tasks.
  • Provide 2nd tier customer support as needed. You will use your in-depth knowledge of our products gained through testing to help our customer support team resolve difficult cases. This role will work directly with our customers via email support to investigate technical problems and find solutions.

Company Culture

You'll work with a talented and highly-motivated team that is friendly, fast-moving, self-managing, and highly capable with a sense of humor. Our team's family time is important; we won't typically require long hours when we can avoid it, which is almost always. Our entire team works remotely using Slack for casual interaction, ­so you can live practically anywhere in the World if you have an Internet connection. There's no micro-­management here—we trust that you will see tasks through to completion and communicate with your fellow team members when needed or ask for help when needed.

At Defiant, ‘trust’ is the attribute we value most highly among our team members. We need to know that you can own testing on various products, communicate clearly with our customers, and see tasks to completion with superb attention to detail.

Requirements

  • Good understanding of WordPress as a CMS and PHP application.
  • General knowledge of Internet protocols, web tools, programming languages and security infrastructures.
  • Problem solving and critical thinking. Ability to perform advanced troubleshooting and guide customers through the same. Ability to search information and evaluate it independently, or present hypotheses to coworkers for input.
  • Experience using bug tracking systems like Fogbugz/Manuscript or similar and experience with the bug workflow, project milestones and interacting with team members via the bug tracking system.
  • Experience with git and github and clear understanding of the github workflow.
  • Ability to read PHP code. This is not a developer position but being able to locate issues in code and reference line numbers in bug reports is extremely helpful.
  • Ability to read and write regular expressions.
  • Ability to read and write SQL.
  • Ability to write test cases.
  • Knowledge of web server platforms like Apache, Nginx and similar is helpful.
  • Must be very comfortable using Linux and comfortable with Linux shell commands and getting around in Linux, including running command line utilities and applications.
  • Understanding of common web vulnerabilities highly favorable.
  • Ability to run command line proof of concept exploits against a web application to test whether it is vulnerable is a requirement.
  • Fast and reliable internet connection
  • A Big Plus If You Have:
    • A keen interest in infosec. Credentials like Security+, CISSP or pen-testing certifications.
    • IPv4 and IPv6, TCP/UDP and general TCP/IP networking knowledge.
    • Experience with pen testing tools like BURP Suite, nmap, Kali, sqlmap and others.
    • Ability to write proof of concept exploits in PHP to test PHP applications.

Hiring Process

  1. Please fill in the form provided in this application. The hiring team will look at this first. The way you answer our form will determine if your application moves to the next step.
  2. Top candidates who appear to have the right skills from the initial application will be sent a more detailed Assessment Test to further assess skills.
  3. Participate in a series of phone interviews.
  4. All contracts and offers of employment are contingent on successful completion of a background check. The results of the background check are considered as they relate to the position and do not automatically disqualify someone from a contract or employment with the company.
  5. Join our fast-paced team and start testing our products and supporting Defiant customers. All positions require a trial period of approximately 2-3 weeks with a minimum commitment of 10 hours per week. You will be paid for this short-term contract, and it will be used to evaluate whether both parties want to pursue an ongoing, regular employment relationship.

Benefits

  • Full time telecommuting and flexible working hours, with a company that has been 100% remote for over 5 years.
  • 100% employee premium and 50% of dependent premium paid by company for premier- level medical, dental, and vision insurance.
  • 21 days PTO per year to start.
  • 401(k) with a 4% Safe Harbor company match that is 100% vested immediately.
  • Latest in laptop and workstation technology.
  • Fitness stipend for a local gym membership or home fitness equipment.
  • Paid training and study time for work-related training and certifications.
  • College tuition reimbursement.

Diversity at Defiant

We value diversity and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, gender identity or expression, marital status, sexual orientation, political ideology, economic status, parental status, or any other non-performance-related status.

Apply

About Defiant Inc

Defiant is a dynamic, fast-growing, and profitable company with loyal customers who love our products and services. We are the global leader in WordPress security, protecting over 2 million websites.

Benefits

  • Full time telecommuting and flexible working hours.
  • Premier- level medical, dental, and vision insurance.
  • 21 days PTO per year.
  • 401(k) with a 4% Safe Harbor company match that is 100% vested.
  • Latest in laptop and workstation technology.
  • Fitness stipend for a local gym membership or home fitness equipment.
  • Paid training and study time for work-related training and certificati
  • College tuition reimbursement.

QA Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: QA/Test Developer
Company: ProKeep – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-08:00) Pacific Time

Technologies

qa
e2e-testing
elixir
wallaby
ruby

Job description

QA Engineer

ProKeep is seeking a QA engineer for a messaging platform that is experiencing rapid growth in the construction industry. This engineer will code on our functional E2E testing suite as well as grow into performance engineering tasks. NOTE: this is a nearly 100% code/automation tasked role and requires a coding exercise as part of the application process.

This is an exciting opportunity for a candidate who wants to grow with an established startup company!

About ProKeep

ProKeep is a software company that has developed a messaging platform for the $100+ billion wholesale distribution market (i.e. plumbing, electrical, HVAC, etc). We are post product, post revenue and growing fast in the US and Canada. Our team is small, nimble, and devoted to making our customers lives easier with simple to use technology. We envision a world where distributors using our tools are more efficient and able to build stronger relationships with their customers.

Responsibilities

We are looking for a dedicated QA/Functional testing engineer who is excited to make significant contribution to our application reliability, performance, and defect management process. You will be primarily focused on functional test automation, but we are a small and highly collaborative team, so from time to time you may also take a diversion into other adjacent tech realms. You don’t have to be an expert with all the tools in our stack, but an interest in working on projects at all levels of the stack will be helpful as we expand the breadth of our platform. You should have strong opinions about tools and architecture, but should also be able to explain those opinions persuasively, not abrasively. You should also take pride in writing performant, logically structured, and readable code, config, and documentation, but be pragmatic enough to realize that sometimes shipped code is better than perfect code. Some training will be provided.

Requirements

  • 3+ years experience working as a QA Engineer
  • E2E functional testing
  • Elixir/wallaby (ruby/capybara and node/chai/mocha for exceptional candidates)
  • Headless chrome/phantom
  • Javascript
  • qa test management SaaS (qtest, zephyr, etc most likely integrated with jira)
  • Running automated tests in CI/CD environment (gitlab)
  • Configuration management
  • Working in a geographically distributed team.
  • Desire to collaborate with other developers and ability to communicate over various channels (email, phone, Slack, Google Hangouts, etc.)

Ideal Skills and Experience

  • Performance tests with jmeter
  • Postgres/RDS capacity and performance improvements.
  • Docker/ECS

Working Relationship

This is a full-time salaried position starting immediately. At this time we can only hire US based

full-time employees and cannot consider consultants or contractors. This is a remote work opportunity, but you should be able to work core hours in U.S. pacific time.

Next Steps

If interested, please email jobs@prokeep.com to introduce yourself and start the process.

Easy apply

About ProKeep

ProKeep is a software company that has developed a messaging platform for the $100+ billion wholesale distribution market (i.e. plumbing, electrical, HVAC, etc). We are post product, post revenue and growing fast in the US and Canada. Our team is small, nimble, and devoted to making our customers lives easier with simple to use technology. We envision a world where distributors using our tools are more efficient and able to build stronger relationships with their customers.

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Mobile Developer, QA/Test Developer
Industry: eCommerce, Retail Apps, Social Commerce
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: CommentSold – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

qa
testing
automated-tests
mobile

Job description

Welcome to the CS Fam CommentSold is a social commerce platform that modernizes the way retailers connect to online shoppers, including hosting live sales events and managing day-to-day retail operations. Simply, we help online retailers do less and sell more. Our team is dispersed throughout the US and Canada, which means we value the diversity and unique collaboration that’s fostered through a remote team. We work incredibly hard for our customers, and believe deeply in our platform’s value. We're a high energy, high growth team and we love to win.In this role, you will
  • Write and execute manual test cases and execute test scripts
  • Assist test lead with the design and development of the test strategy and roadmap
  • Perform unit testing
  • Participate in production deployments and releases to ensure successful deployments
  • Facilitate user acceptance testing
  • Document and report defects and track defects to closure, escalating as appropriate

If you're great for this role, you

  • Have 2-3+ years building test plans and running manual acceptance tests specifically testing Android and/or iOS platforms and web applications
  • Can eloquently explain defects, test plans, and different quality assurance efforts
  • Can effectively communicate defect details and reproduction steps
  • Have the ability/desire to understand and rapidly learn new technologies
  • Are organized and have strong time management skills
  • Love solving problems and finding solutions
  • Are self-motivated and self-directing
  • Are comfortable in a fast paced, pragmatic work environment
  • Have worked on a remote team
Apply

About CommentSold

At CommentSold, we’re building social commerce tools for retailers to maximize their customer reach and engagement, and streamline their day to day operations. We’re redefining how retailers connect with their customers -- making shopping a little more personal, and a lot more fun. 

Our team is dispersed throughout the US and Canada, which means we value the perspective and unique collaboration that’s fostered through a remote-first team. We work incredibly hard for our customers, and believe deeply in our platform’s value. We're a high energy, high growth team and we love to win.

Our Product and Engineering teams stays close to our customers, building the tools to deliver on our promise to make running their business easier. We make decisions fast, and priorities change as we adapt to the needs of our industry so we welcome folks that relish in the challenges of pace. We believe in quick iteration and in the moment feedback, so we can work collectively to build the best team and product.

Benefits

  • Remote workspace allowance
  • Coworking space reimbursement
  • Internet reimbursement
  • Wellness allowance
  • Health, vision, and dental insurance
  • Generous parental leave policy + returning parent bonus
  • 401k with matching

  • Remote-first, work from anywhere culture

items.content:
Salary: Highly competitive

Remote working, office based or a mixture - whatever suits you best

Most of our Dev Team have been with us 7+ years - says it all. Come and you will enjoy!

Ride a baby Unicorn

Over 1 million people worldwide are using our software tools to boost their productivity and creativity, and we’re proud to have become the first Welsh company ever to join the London Stock Exchange Elite accelerator programme. We have ambitious plans for growth, and are looking for positive, passionate and self-motivated developers to join our growing team.

OpenGenius Ltd owns and is headquartered in the highly desirable offices at Tec Marina, Penarth. Find out more about Tec Marina at www.tecmarina.com complete with free parking nearby, 5-star gym and top-quality bean to cup coffee machines!

Our new app, Ayoa.com is changing the way people work, think, create, learn, and collaborate.

The opportunity

We are a team of skilled, motivated individuals working in an Agile environment on our globally successful product Ayoa. As a developer at OpenGenius Ltd, you will help shape the direction of our current and future products by becoming part of the team and helping to design, implement and deliver features and improvements to our products.

About you

We are looking for a tester with at least 3 years experience testing web & mobile applications and products. You will be working closely with developers, product owners, designers and other testers to continually deliver updates to our web, desktop apps, Android app and backend infrastructure and services.

We’re looking for someone who is passionate about UI/UX, preferably within visiting distance to our office. At present, we’re working 100% remotely. Ideally, you will be able to visit the office periodically once our situation changes.

The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate skills such as:

  • 3 years experience of testing
  • Experience working within an agile environment
  • Experience gathering requirements & defining acceptance criteria
  • Attention to detail
  • Aptitude for exploratory testing
  • Excellent communicator (particularly with other remote workers)
  • Able to handle a large volume of work in a fast paced environment

Desirable:

  • Experience in writing BDD scenarios
  • A keenness to explore test automation
  • Experience testing desktop, browser and mobile apps

Perks

  • Free use of onsite 5-star gym and shower rooms.
  • Free unlimited tea, hot chocolate and bean-to-cup coffee.
  • Flexible working hours
  • Remote working available
  • Happy Birthday – Take the day off, paid!
  • 20-27 days holiday + Bank holidays per year (accumulate an extra 2 days holiday every full year you are with us)

Work in one of the coolest office spaces in the UK

OpenGenius owns and is headquartered in the highly desirable offices at Tec Marina, Penarth. With plenty of free parking and just a short walk away from Cogan train station, you’ll be joining a well-connected, highly creative and collaborative community, passionate in developing innovative and creative software solutions.

We reward attitude, ability and performance. For the right candidate, this is an invaluable opportunity for business and career growth. If you’re looking to work within a driven, hard-working and committed team who are inspired to change the way that millions of people think and work for the better, we would love to hear from you. Apply now with a CV and covering email explaining your experience and suitability for the role.

items.title: Rocket.Chat: QA Tester
items.content:
QA Tester

We are looking for a QA Tester to assess software quality through manual and automated testing. You will be responsible for finding and reporting bugs and glitches, so you should have a keen eye for detail and excellent communication skills. If you feel competent in executing test cases and are passionate about quality, we’d love to meet you.

What you’ll do
Ultimately, you will ensure that our product, applications and systems work correctly. For that, you will:
  • Execute test cases (manual or automated) and analyze results
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop effective strategies and test plans, ensuring quality through the development lifecycle
  • Review and analyze system specifications
  • Evaluate product code according to specifications
  • Create logs to document testing phases and defects
  • Report bugs and errors to development teams and help troubleshoot issues
  • Conduct post-release/post-implementation testing

What’s required
We need you to have proven experience as a Quality Assurance Tester or in a similar role, knowledge about project management and QA methodology, and great communication skills, so fluent English is essential! This position is open for remote work, so there’s no location requirement.
Other skills we’re looking for are:
  • Familiarity with Agile frameworks and regression testing is a plus
  • Ability to document and troubleshoot errors
  • Working knowledge of test management software (e.g. qTest, Zephyr) and SQL
  • Attention to detail
  • Analytical mind and problem-solving aptitude
  • Strong organizational skills
    
Benefits
Wherever you are our goal is to make your routine as a Rocketeer feel enjoyable, exciting and comfortable, so if you are remote or working from our office in Porto Alegre (Brazil) you’ll receive a set of benefits to improve your work experience!

About Rocket.Chat
Today one of the largest open source projects in the world with more than 1000 developers, Rocket.Chat has advanced as a platform that empowers people to collaborate with others, while empowering individual teams to fully customize their platform to meet their unique needs.
As Rocket.Chat we believe in collaborating to create a more collaborative world! See yourself in that? So apply now!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
QA Engineer (m/f)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: QA/Test Developer
Company: Secucloud GmbH – No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin

Technologies

cloud
testing
python

Job description

Secucloud GmbH is active worldwide as a provider of highly available cyber-security solutions, offering a cloud-based SaaS (security-as-a-service) platform, particularly for telecommunications providers.

The Elastic Cloud Security System (ECS2) allows a wide range of markets and target groups (mobile communications and landline consumers, small businesses and home offices, SMEs) to enjoy the benefits of enterprise level security solutions. This innovative platform does not require any special hardware or proprietary appliances, scales automatically, and is capable of supporting more than 100 million users and their connected devices.

We are currently expanding our QA team and are looking for QA Engineers with various levels of experience.

Tasks

  • Testing of large scale highly available network security solutions
  • Developing test cases and automated tests
  • Covering all aspects of QA: requirements, functionality, usability, performance, etc.

Requirements

  • Strong experience in testing backend applications/services and APIs

  • Very solid understanding of TCP/IP networking - ideally in an ISP/telco environment

  • Very solid understanding of Linux/Unix based systems

  • Proficient in shell / Python scripting

  • Telecommunications Engineering degree would be strongly preferred

  • Knowledge and experience in one or more of the following would be a plus:

    • Virtualization technologies (VMware, KVM, etc.)

    • Cloud services and technologies (AWS, Azure, etc.)

    • Monitoring and alarming toolkits (Nagios, Icinga, SNMP traps, Grafana, etc.)

    • Automated installations and configurations (Ansible, etc.)

    • SQL and noSQL databases

  • Flexible, but goal-oriented mindset; well-planned, self-reliant, highly motivated

  • Very good knowledge of written and spoken English

  • German is not required, but would be a plus

Benefits

  • A modern workplace in a prime city location, in an excellent working atmosphere
  • A highly motivated and international team
  • A flat hierarchy and short decision-making processes
  • Development opportunities tailored to your needs
  • Numerous additional services, drinks, daily fresh smoothies, regular events, personal fitness trainer, massages and many other Secucloud benefits.

You are interested? Show us what you are capable of and send us your application. Your contact person is Silke Utnehmer.

Apply

About Secucloud GmbH

Die Secucloud GmbH ist ein Anbieter von hochverfügbaren Cyber-Security-Lösungen und bietet eine cloudbasierte Security-as-a-Service Plattform.

items.content:
We created Waggel because we believe technology can make pet ownership easier and more joyful for dog and cat owners.


Our industry leading and fully-digital pet insurance product was launched in December 2018 and has been featured on TechCrunch amongst others. We've since experienced rapid month-on-month growth taking us to our first thousand customers within our first year of trading, resulting in plenty of 5* reviews!


Over the next year we'll be focusing on our members app, the purpose of which is to enrich the lives of our predominantly London-based millennial members and their pets through an aspirational and personalised app that encourages and rewards healthy behaviours akin to Vitality.


In order to improve the robustness of our insurance product and the members app, we are looking for a QA engineer who can join our product team based just down the road from Shoreditch, though remote working from anywhere in the UK is an option.


 


The Role


You'll be championing high quality deliverables by facilitating continuous browser and device testing of new features and bugs. This will be done in two parts:



  • Automated testing - Written in TypeScript, you’ll be using tools such as Playwright, Node.JS, GraphQL and Jest to write automated unit, integration and end to end tests across our micro-service architecture.

  • Manual testing - Before features and bug fixes are shipped to production you’ll be responsible for testing the functionality and design requirements. This will be for both desktop and mobile browsers and mobile apps.


 


About You



  • Strong work experience in JavaScript and/or Typescript. If your experience is mainly as a developer that’s absolutely fine.

  • Quick - You’re going to be the QA for 3 developers, so you need to be able to write code quickly and testing things manually at a fast pace, without sacrificing quality. You should thrive under pressure!

  • Enthusiastic and proactive - Bring ideas to the table, over step your boundaries and challenge those around you.

  • Confident communicator - Experience adapting communication to suit a variety of stakeholders including engineering, creative and marketing teams.

  • Comfortable with MVP and iterative development - Pragmatism is king when you're punching above your weight in a big industry so you should be comfortable with an MVP philosophy.

  • Design driven - You have an eye for design and compromise makes you sick.

  • Customer centric - You will put the customer experience first at all times.

  • Dog friendly - You love and are not allergic to dogs (we have several in the office).


 


Your Responsibilities



  • Determining when and where to write automated tests for different features and bug fixes. We use continuous integration so it’s very important to know that the product is working as expected.

  • Briefing in work to the wider product team in sprint planning sessions.

  • Derive insight from our customer services team to better inform our understanding of our product and our members.

  • Acting as the main point of sign off for any work going to production. You’ll need to be able to demonstrate new features and bug fixes to any relevant stakeholders if further sign off is required.


 


Requirements



  • 3-5 years work experience in a JavaScript and/or TypeScript development or automated testing role.

  • Any experience with automated testing would be ideal.

  • Familiar with requirements gathering and documentation techniques.

  • Experience working in the same room as designers and engineers.

  • Competent understanding of product testing practices.

  • Great interpersonal skills.

  • Team mentality - we work together, take risks together, celebrate together and stay humble together.


 


Your Portfolio Should



  • Clearly demonstrate a passion for web development and testing.

  • Evidence your ability to write high quality JavaScript and/or TypeScript.

  • Show your ability at having an eye for detail and improving upon things.


 


Bonus Points



  • Experience working as a JavaScript/TypesScript developer.

  • Experience writing automated tests.

  • Experience working in pet and/or finance.

  • Experience performing manual testing across mobile and web based products.


 


Salary



  • £30,000 per annum

items.content:
QA Engineer

Company: Xpand IT
Requires Work Permit
Language:
QA / Testing
Skills:
Must Have: Test AutomationOther Required: Continuous Delivery, Scrum, TestingNice to Have: Git, Jira, Software Development
Skills:

Intro

ABOUT US…

Everything we do is to inspire others to achieve outstanding results. We do this by investing in IT mastery to generate market value. As a global company specializing in Big Data, Business Intelligence & Analytics, Data Science, Middleware, Digital Xperiences, and Collaboration and Development tools, we have top products and services used by Fortune 500 companies. With a posture of honesty and cooperation with more than 180 clients in the service area and more than 3000 that use our products in 76 different countries, Xpand IT is recognized for its technological knowledge and “Passion for Excellence”.

At Xpand IT, everyone has a special talent. We value everyone’s talent in all fields. Excellent technical experts, visionary designers, dynamic and communicative Human Resources team, innovative researchers, magical marketers, entrepreneurial managers. These are the people that are part of Xpand IT.

If you feel that Xpand IT is the right place for you, give us a call.

 

ABOUT THE JOB

The product team at Xpand IT builds cutting edge software testing tools. Our flagship product, Xray, leads the test management market. More than 4.5 million users at 8000+ companies trust Xray to manage 100+ million test cases every month. Every day, we work to provide integrated solutions that transform how our customers develop, test and ship the software they make.

As a QA Engineer you will be an active member of the product engineering team and participate, from the product design stages to the final production roll out. You will help with requirements definition, so you can elaborate the correct test plans and communicate with Product Owner in order to guarantee the full impact and “big picture” of all issues that will be tested. As an active member of the team you will also work directly with the development team and Automation team, to ensure everything runs smoothly.


JOB DESCRIPTION/ACTIVITIES

  • Collaborate with the team to identify system requirements.
  • Prepare and execute detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans, test cases, and test scripts for functional and non-functional requirements.
  • Keep track and communicate test plans, test results, analysis, and unresolved problems.
  • Coordinate schedules to ensure on-time delivery of all testing activities.
  • Review requirements and functional specifications and project technical documents.
  • Identify, analyze and report defects, questionable functions, errors, and inconsistencies in software subsets, outputs, online screens and content.
  • Stay up to date with system requirements, and with new testing tools and test strategies.
  • Promote continuous improvement initiatives of both product and process functions within the team.



 

Main requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science/IT or related field or equivalent experience
  • Solid knowledge and minimum of 2 years of experience of professional coding experience with any programming language
  • 2 years of professional experience as part of a test team and experience contributing to test automation and frameworks
  • Previous experience developing software test cases
  • Familiarity with Test Management Software
  • Being able to use development methodologies (Scrum) and tools (Confluence, JIRA, Git, Jenkins, Bamboo)
  • Innovation capacity, good communication skills and easy integration into working teams
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken)

Nice to have

  • Knowledge of software testing software tools such as Xray, Cucumber and Selenium.

Benefits & Perks

Besides a competitive salary and a variable bonus program according to the performance, we have a number of other benefits:

  • Work in a software product team
  • World-class customers
  • Flexible work hours and partial remote work
  • Relaxed work environment
  • Fruit and coffee available
  • Health insurance
  • Training plan, adjusted to individual needs
  • Opportunity to work on challenging projects in different locations
  • Social and team building events
  • Areas for leisure within the facilities
  • Protocols and other local benefits

PingPong

 

Website and App Tester


Worldwide
We’re looking to talk to people to get feedback on apps and websites. Earn up to €40 per hour by taking part in friendly online interviews and tests. All from the comfort of your home! We're looking for people from any country. # Responsibilities * You sign up on our website and enter your personal details—this should only take 2 minutes. The more details you share about yourself, the more interviews we can match you too, and the more money you can earn. * When a new interview is posted, you’ll receive an invitation via email. You’ll need to answer a few quick questions and pick a time to participate in the paid interview. * On the day of the interview, log in to our website, switch on your webcam and microphone and participate in the conversation. You don’t need any specific education background or special skills—just be yourself, think aloud and share your opinion! * You’ll get paid via PayPal / Transferwise about 7 days after the interview. # Requirements * A stable internet connection, webcam and microphone are essential for the interview video call. * Turn up on-time. Others will be waiting for you! * You need a PayPal account to receive your payment. * Our website, and many of our interviews are in English, but we are also looking for Spanish, Italian, French, German, Korean (insert any language here) speakers to participate. Please note: this isn't a full time position or a role where we can guarantee a fixed income. #Salary €20 yagJzhkdapAsCMnUw7CpJAMi #Location - Worldwide

items.content:
ProKeep

QA Engineer

verified
QA Engineer  ProKeep is seeking a QA engineer for a messaging platform that is experiencing rapid growth in the construction industry. This developer will work on our functional E2E testing suite as well as performance engineering tasks. This is an exciting opportunity for a candidate who wants to grow with an established startup company! About ProKeep ProKeep is a software company that has developed a messaging platform for the $100+ billion wholesale distribution market (i.e. plumbing, electrical, HVAC, etc). We are post product, post revenue and growing fast in the US and Canada. Our team is small, nimble, and devoted to making our customers lives easier with simple to use technology. We envision a world where distributors using our tools are more efficient and able to build stronger relationships with their customers. Responsibilities We are looking for a dedicated QA/Functional testing engineer who is excited to make significant contribution to our application reliability, performance, and defect management process. You will be primarily focused on functional test automation, but we are a small and highly collaborative team, so from time to time you may also take a diversion into other adjacent tech realms. You don’t have to be an expert with all the tools in our stack, but an interest in working on projects at all levels of the stack will be helpful as we expand the breadth of our platform. You should have strong opinions about tools and architecture, but should also be able to explain those opinions persuasively, not abrasively. You should also take pride in writing performant, logically structured, and readable code, config, and documentation, but be pragmatic enough to realize that sometimes shipped code is better than perfect code. Some training will be provided. Requirements * 3+ years experience working as a QA Engineer * E2E functional testing * Elixir/wallaby (ruby/capybara and node/chai/mocha for exceptional candidates) * Headless chrome/phantom * Javascript * qa test management SaaS (qtest, zephyr, etc most likely integrated with jira) * Running automated tests in CI/CD environment (gitlab) * Configuration management * Working in a geographically distributed team. * Desire to collaborate with other developers and ability to communicate over various channels (email, phone, Slack, Google Hangouts, etc.) Ideal Skills and Experience * Performance tests with jmeter * Postgres/RDS capacity and performance improvements. * Docker/ECS Working Relationship This is a full-time salaried position starting immediately. At this time we can only hire US based full-time employees and cannot consider consultants or contractors. This is a remote work opportunity, but you should be able to work core hours in U.S. pacific time. Next Steps If interested, please email [email protected] to introduce yourself and start the process. yagJzhkdapAsCMnUw7CpJAMi
